I didn't mean police. He continues thinking. Carol watches him for a moment. CAROL
Tell me about it. Doc looks across at her. DOC
(calmly) Loredo is out. I've been thinking about Rudy. If he was on his own, we're okay. If Beynon bought him out... Doc looks at her. CAROL
What?
DOC
If Beynon bought him out, and he talked then maybe Beynon's boys will be waiting for us in El Paso. Rudy knew about Laughlins. CAROL
You're full of ifs. DOC
I think you liked it with him. I think he got to you. CAROL
Maybe. At least I got to him. (pause) Where do we go from here? DOC
El Paso.

head_text.subj: A WATER PISTOL APPEARS AROUND THE CORNER OF AN EMPTY

text: PASSENGER CHAIR. The seven year old brat   squeezes off s plumes of water. The Thief is hit by the   gun's spray, w runs slowly down his ear and the back of   his neck. KID

Bang! THE BOY WATCHES THE IMMOBILE MAN. He fires again, once ag there is no reaction. The brat steps forward... smiling, pushes the thief's arm, pushes harder. THE THIEF'S BODY SUDDENLY FALLS BACK ACROSS THE CHAIR. Hi eyes roll upward... staring at the panther. His neck is bruised, he pushes his hat back slowly. THIEF
(very hoarsely) Get me a doctor.

CAROL SLEEPS ON HER STOMACH, her head resting across one Doc lies beside her, eyes open. He looks over at Carol a moment, noting the long strands of hair that move rhythmically back and forth from her gentle breathing. Af a moment Doc quietly stands, moves to the writing table a stares at the black suitcase.
He opens the valise and lifts the large stack of greenbac into a shaft of light coming through a crack in the drawn shade. Still holding the money, Doc looks back at Carol.

head_text.subj: ONE LAST TIGHTLY BOUND MONEY PAD

text: Printed clearly on the brown wrapper.

A PLAINCLOTHES OFFICER HOLDS A SIMILAR MONEY PAD with his handkerchief. The Panther is sitting with his mother on a nearby seat. Still dressed in his panther suit, but no lo a brat. His face reflects both fear and shock.

head_text.subj: THE THIEF IS WITH THEM, BANDAGED AROUND THE THROAT

text: PLAINCLOTHES OFFICER
(to the Thief) Where did you get it? THIEF
(hoarsely) It was a gift.
CAROL COMES IN. SHE IS WEARING A NEW SUIT, SANDALS It loo great... She tosses a package on the bed. Doc looks at her outfit and opens his. They are too flash DOC
Thanks. (as Carol starts to speak) You look great, just great... They could pick you up for soliciting in ten minutes. CAROL
That would be the first time. DOC
(angry) When are you going to learn? CAROL
I did I killed a man.
Doc throws his clothes away. DOC

(laughing) And that could be all for you., baby. Carol suddenly angered slaps him. Doc immediately delivers her a stinging blow. Carol hits the wall then stands stunned as he quietly tie his laces and pulls on his jacket. Doc stuffs the Colt .4 into the flapped outside pocket along with 2 clips. He tu to the bed and picks up the suitcase. Carol continues looking at Doc. DOC (CONT'D)
Now you learn3 this time it could be the chair for both of us. Carol starts to speak. DOC (CONT'D)
(continuing) From now on you just shut up and do as you're told. CAROL
If I hadn't killed Beynon., you would have. Doc doesn't answer. He turns and exits. She follows.

head_text.subj: PICTURES OF MEN LOOKING SOMETHING LIKE DOC.

text: Printed at one side of the photographs are their criminal records.

head_text.subj: THE SENIOR DETECTIVE AND THE TWO PLAINCLOTHES

text: OFFICERS are seated within the Communication room of the department. The transcriber comes to life as the cylinder receiver begins to turn.
THE CYLINDER NOW REVEALS DOC MeCOY'S FACE.

head_text.subj: CONDUCTOR, MOTHER AND SON AND THIEF

text: Yes, that's him. No question about it. That's him. DETECTIVE
(pointing to the thief) How about him? THIEF
(hoarsely) Listen, I'm a friend of the Court. DETECTIVE
You are here because you're under arrest.
ON A BEDSTAND. THE FREQUENCY HAND INDICATOR GLOWS with a yellow light. RADIO

... The man has been positively identified as Carter Doc" McCoy, only recently paroled from a penitentiary where he was serving time for armed robbery. He is believed to be travelling with his wife, Carol Ainsley McCoy... (ad libs)

RUDY REACHES OVER TO THE NIGHTSTAND AND SHUTS OFF the rad His eyes stare vacantly ahead for a moment. HAROLD CLINTON IS TIED SECURELY INTO A CHAIR, his mouth tightly gagged. RUDY BEGINS TO SMILE. FRAN IS NEXT TO RUDY WITHIN THE bed wearing only a bra, sleeping, one arm wrapped around Rudy middle. RUDY

How you doing over there, Harold? You sleep okay last night? Good. I'm glad to hear it. Did you listen to the news? That means we don't have to drive so hard today, Harold... we're gonna be travelling a lot faster than they are... We got a lot more time than I figured.
Rudy continues smiling. He pulls the sheet away from Fran then allows his hand to reach down, cupping her breast fr inside the bra. Fran half awakens, pulls herself closer t Rudy.
HAYHOE, THE ACCOUNTANT and the rest of the boys are sitti in the office waiting.
RUDY IS DRIVING NOW, Fran and Harold are not speaking.
DOC AND CAROL. DOC IS DRIVING. They are also silent.

CANNON (one of the Accountant's boys, whom we have not se before) ENTERS THE DARK NEARLY DESERTED LOBBY and approac the reception desk. The large room is populated by overstuffed and threadbare furniture. LAUGHLIN looks very much like Dub Taylor and speaks Spani just about as badly. He flashes a quick grin from behind counter as Cannon draws near. At the switchboard behind Laughlin, CARMEN, maybe 35, sits next to the telephone ja (all of them idle) readinc a movie magazine. CANNON
You Laughlin? LAUGHLIN
(Mr. Friendly) Yes, sir, and that's my wife and that's Junior. Laughlin indicates a seventeen year old BELLBOY sleeping one of the overstuffed chairs. CANNON
Congratulations. I need a room. LAUGHLIN
No trouble. You came to the right place, one thing we got is a lot of rooms. What else can I do for you?

AS IT MOTORS DOWN THE TEXAS HIGHWAY. The black suitcase i propped up between Doc and Carol in the front seat. Doc, seated on the passenger side, bangs the car radio with hi hand. The radio is obviously not working as he turns the dials and pushes the buttons. DOC
(cajoling it) C'mon workl I (almost pleading) C'mon. We hear garbled words for a moment, pleasing Doc... and t the radio conks out again. This time Doc hits the radio h DOC (CONT'D)
(angrily to the radio) Give me the news!! When it is clear that the radio won't work: DOC (CONT'D)
You can't trust anything these days. CAROL
I'll tell you something, Doc. One day you're going to have to trust somebody... DOC SLAMS THE BRAKE, GRABS THE WHEEL as the car veers ove the side of the road. DOC
I trust... (he opens the black suitcase) Want to see what I trust... In God we trust... (he pulls out a bill and points at it) The word's on every bill!!! CAROL

(slamming the suitcase closed) You keep it up and it won't matter how far we get away, because it's going to be all over between you and me. Do you understand that? There won't be anything left. She starts the car up again, and continues driving, her knuckles tightening around the steering wheel.

head_text.subj: AS IT LEISURELY MOVES ALONG THE ROADWAY BORDERED BY MILES

text: SAGEBRUSH. Harold drives, Fran is again in the front seat beside her husband... a scrunched up sack of food beside She wipes her mouth with a napkin, shoves it inside the p bag, then turns to watch the passing scenery. Rudy sits i the back, eating spareribs. He suddenly throws a just finished bone at Fran, hitting her on the shoulder. RUDY
Have a bone, baby. He throws another sparerib at Fran. FRAN
(shouts) Oh, Christ, you wrecked my blouse. God damn it, Rudy, what did you do that for? Jesus. RUDY

(laughing) I'll tell you why I did it... it makes me feel good. He laughs and again throws another bone at Fran. She sudd catches his mood and begins laughing herself ... tossing bone back at Rudy. HAROLD CONTINUES DRIVING. His knuckles whiten around the steering wheel as a sparerib bounces off the window in fr of him. THE KITTEN IS SLEEPING WITHIN the cardboard box, obliviou Rudy and Fran's laughter. (That will be the day.)
THE CHEVY MOVES ALONG with the light mid-day traffic, pas various roadside business establishments, then pulls up before a radio/TV repair and sales shop.

ALL THE LATEST MODEL RADIOS are stacked on shelves around small room... a television display featuring several mode is in one corner of the shop. Another TV is playing near counter and the PROPRIETOR'S desk. DOC
A portable.
PROPRIETOR
Transistor? DOC

Yeah. The Proprietor moves to a shelf. THE SCREEN. As Doc's picture suddenly flashes onto the tu with appropriate dialogue. DOC STARING AT THE TELEVISION, then he quickly reaches ov and snaps the set off. THE PROPRIETOR BRINGS OUT SOME RADIOS, seemingly obliviou Doc's action. PROPRIETOR

15 to 55 dollars -- take your pick. DOC TURNS, then looks at the corner of the small shop. ALL THE TELEVISION SETS have Doc's picture on them. DOC TURNS BACK TO THE PROPRIETOR -- the man is looking at not at the sets. DOC
(paying) Fifty -- Taking a set, he exits. PROPRIETOR
You have change. But he doesn't answer.
CAROL TURNS AS DOC STICKS HIS HEAD through the open door, hands her the set. DOC
We got trouble. Let's take a walk. DOC AND CAROL WALKING UP THE SIDEWALK OP THE SMALL TOWN. turn into a Sporting Goods Store. The Chevy is behind the block away.
THE PROPRIETOR LOOKS CAREFULLY OUT THE WINDOW AT THE empt car, then turns and grabs his telephone.

head_text.subj: CAROL REMAINS BY THE FRONT WINDOW, PRETENDING TO

text: EXAMINE some fishing equipment as she keeps her eye on th street. Doc moves to the counter at the rear of the store. An ATTENDANT moves up to help Doc. SALESMAN
(with a smile) Can I help you? DOC
Sure can. I'd like an Invicta 12-gauge pump with the twenty-inch barrel. SALESMAN
All right. Shells? DOC
Two boxes of double-ought buck. SALESMAN
Gonna knock down a wall? DOC
(big smile) Might try that. The Salesman puts a form in front of Doc then goes to the rack behind him, lifts off a short-barreled shotgun and begins to wrap it.
Sign here.

head_text.subj: CAROL, AT THE FRONT OP THE STORE, WATCHES THE STREET INTE

text: THE RADIO-REPAIRMAN EXITS THE SHOP AS A POLICE CAR comes the street and makes a U-turn... stopping near the Chevy. After a brief conversation the Radio-Repairman goes back inside his store and the police car pulls forward, down t street from the Chevy.
THE TWO COPS LOOK LIKE HOMER AND JETHRO. Both men stare h at the now staked-out Chevy.

head_text.subj: AT THE COUNTER THE SALESMAN LAYS OUT THE GUN AND THE BOXE

text: SHELLS. As Doc empties the loose shells into his coat poc CAROL TURNS, LOOKS AT DOC, THEIR EYES MEET. Doc reads her knows that the police are in the street.

head_text.subj: AT THE COUNTER THE SALESMAN PUTS A STRING AROUND THE BROW

text: SALESMAN
Be one hundred and eighty-five thirty- two. Doc quickly pays the man. DOC
Much obliged. Doc turns as the Salesman drifts over to another Customer he approaches Carol at the store window. CAROL
Only one car. DOC
Let's do it. Carol moves ahead of Doc,, exits the Sporting Goods Store starts up the sidewalk.

head_text.subj: DOC WATCHES HER FOR A MOMENT, THEN HEADS FOR THE DOOR HIM
CAROL WALKS ALONE BACK TOWARDS THE CAR.

text: HOMER AND JETHRO CONTINUE STARING AT THE CHEW. Their car pointed towards the Radio Store, its back to the Sporting Goods house. DOC LEAVES THE SPORTING GOODS STORE, CROSSES THE STREET a begins walking up the opposite sidewalk, back towards the Chevy.

head_text.subj: CAROL PASSES THE POLICE CAR AND NEARS THE CHEVY

text: THE TWO RURAL COPS MOVE INTO ACTION; their car pulls forw and parks diagonally across the street, partially blockin the roadway as xvell as nearly obstructing the Chevy.

head_text.subj: CAROL STANDS FROZEN AS HOMER AND JETHRO HOP OUT OF THE PO

text: car, guns drawn.

head_text.subj: DOC CROSSES THE STREET BEHIND THE COP CAR

text: HE LEVELS HIS big gun... Doc FIRES the shotgun through the "brown wrapping paper p blank into the squad car, caving in one side of the machi and blasting the radiator into a steaming wreck. Homer and Jethro hit the ground, paralyzed with fright as their car EXPLODES behind them. With three more BLASTS Doc blows most of the top off the police car then calmly reloads. DOC

Slide those guns! The two cops send their guns clattering across the paveme CAROL HAS INSTANTLY MOVED BACK INTO THE CHEVY, started th engine and begun maneuvering it out onto the street. She makes a U-turn, then pulls up near Doc. DOC STEPS FORWARD, KICKS THE TWO PISTOLS BACK UNDER the police car near the gas tank. He walks to the back of the car. Carol throws open the passenger door of the Chevy. Doc SHOOTS the gas tank of the squad car, it instantly ignites. Walking calmly around the burning police car Doc then sta to climb into the Chevy. Carol REVS the engine. Doc pauses a moment, looking back at the prone police officers and the blazing automobile.

Carol guns the car forward -- Doc, unprepared for the Che sudden movement, falls flat on his face across the paveme CAROL THROWS THE CHEVY INTO REVERSE, AND ROARS back to pi up Doc. DOC, A LITTLE CHAGRINED, PICKS HIMSELF UP, GRABS his gun jumps into the Chevy. He slams the door closed, Carol aga tears forward -- tires peeling down the pavement. HOMER AND JETHRO RAISE THEMSELVES. With very long faces t study the burning remains of their once proud squad car.
THE CHEVY SPEEDS OUT OF TOWN,, onto an open stretch of ro
DOC JAMS ONE MORE SHELL INTO HIS PAPER-WRAPPED gun -- Car grips the wheel tightly concentrating on the road... the Chevy continues to accelerate.
THE CHEVY CROSSES THE ROAD'S BROKEN WHITE LINE and passes lumbering Greyhound bus. DOC, STARING AT THE HIGHWAY BEHIND THEM; the bus fades of into the horizon...

(finally) Here. THE CHEVY PULLS OFF THE HIGHWAY, MOVES UP A DIRT road for twenty yards then pulls into a cornfield of a well laid o farm, smashing through the six foot high stalks. Well out sight, the Chevy slams to an abrupt halt.

head_text.subj: DOC AND CAROL, RUNNING THROUGH THE CORNFIELD AND BACK UP

text: DIRT road toward the highway. Doc still carries his gun i the brown wrapping paper. Carol labors with the suitcase she runs. ON THE HIGHWAY DOC STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD, wavi both arms overhead. The Greyhound bus comes to a lurching halt, Doc and Carol scramble aboard.
DOC BUYS TWO FARES FROM THE SCOWLING GREYHOUND DRIVER. Th bus again moves forward.

DOC AND CAROL SITTING TOGETHER ON THE BUS, Doc hold- 4l4 his camouflaged gun. They lean back on their padded seats the bus jostles along the road. Suddenly... Two Police Cars pass the bus, SIRENS screamin lights turning... Doc and Carol's eyes meet... One more Black and White passes the bus and races on down road.

head_text.subj: DOC WEARS A SUNBEATEN LEATHER JACKET, READING A NEWSPAPER

text: while leaning against a hot dog stand. One foot rests on suitcase. The Invicta has been re-wrapped in a laundry ba The paper is filled with news of the robbery and a mug sh of Doc. A GREY MERCURY PULLS UP NEAR THE DOGGIE DINER. Carol is driving. Doc walks up to the window of the car.

head_text.subj: DOC LEANS IN THROUGH THE WINDOW.

text: DOC
Where are you going? CAROL
El Paso. Doc opens the door and moves into the driver's seat. DOC
How much? CAROL
Twenty eight hundred. As she looks at him, he smiles: DOC
Are you hungry? CAROL
Not now. He drives off.

head_text.subj: FRAN IS CUDDLING WITH RUDY IN THE BACK SEAT.

text: HAROLD
I've got to stop. RUDY
(as Fran!s hands move over him) I'll tell you when.

head_text.subj: A FRONTAGE ROAD BORDERING THE EDGE OF A GOOD-SIZED TOWN.

text: Carol now driving,, pulls off the highway and into an "Oa drive-in restaurant. THE MERCURY COMES TO A STOP WITHIN A ROW OF CARS FACING t indoor portion of the restaurant.

skinny girl, wearing a brown jacket and slacks, approache the car carrying two menus. She arrives with a smile. Doc leans forward, looking past Carol at the waitress, he lif his hand, not accepting the bill of fare. DOC
That's okay, honey. Two cheeseburgers; two coffees and a milkshake. GIRL
How about fries? DOC
(big smile) Why not? The Car Hop walks back across the raised cement sidewalk towards the kitchen area...
HAROLD IS TIED TO A CHAIR, RUDY IS LYING ON THE BED, half clothed, eating chicken, drinking a beer, while Fran slow strips down to bra and panties.
DOC AND CAROL WATCH AS THE CAR HOP PREPARES to bolt the serving tray onto the car-door window. GIRL
Could you roll it up part way?
CAROL
Sure thing. The girl clamps the tray to the window. The Car Hop narro her features, looking at Doc and Carol then smiles and tu and heads back toward the kitchen.

head_text.subj: DOC REACHES UP AND CASUALLY ADJUSTS THE REAR VIEW MIRROR
THE MIRROR HAS BEEN TURNED TO REVEAL THE HIGHWAY AND THE
ENTRANCE TO THE DRIVE-IN'S PARKING LOT

text: CAROL BEGINS TO EAT, she looks casually at the mirror.

head_text.subj: DOC SLOWLY EATS HIS CHEESEBURGER, TAKES A SIP OF MILKSHAK

text: CAROL REACHES FOR HER COFFEE, spills it and then reaches the light switch knob on the dashboard.
THE CAR HOP AT THE PICK-UP STAND, notes the lights 429 th turns her head the opposite direction, pretending not to

head_text.subj: DOC WATCHES THE WAITRESS TURN AWAY

text: THE CAR HOP STARES AT THE CEMENT PAVEMENT. Within the kit behind her the cooks all look toward the parking lot... t faces expectant.
DOC

She made us. Carol looks into the rear view mirror. Across the wide lo police car appears, cutting in off the highway. Doc goes into the back seat, Carol kicks the engine over, jams the stick into gear. All this is accomplished while staring into the rear view mirror. DOC LIFTS THE LAUNDRY BAG-COVERED SHOTGUN onto his lap. THE POLICE CAR cruises slowly along the line of autos...

head_text.subj: TWO OFFICERS SCAN THE PARKING LOT. THE PASSENGER COP CRAD

text: a riot gun. PASSENGER COP
Mercury.
THE SQUAD CAR PULLS TO A STOP FIFTEEN FEET behind the Mercury, seemingly blocking the way. DOC

Now. CAROL STANDS ON THE ACCELERATOR. THE MERCURY GOES screami forward, as Doc shoots out the back window. Then, as the terrified cops duck to the side, he shoots out their fron windshield. The Mercury bounces up across the sidewalk as empty plates and glasses topple off the serving tray and across the concrete. The car slams back down through a va space on the opposite side, and moves around in a semicir across the asphalt, heading for the highway exit. DOC SMASHES OUT THE REAR WINDOW with the butt of his shot THE BLACK AND WHITE NOW IN REVERSE, ZOOMING BACK, trying get between the Mercury and the highway.

head_text.subj: CAROL BRINGING THE CAR AROUND, SHE CAN SEE THE SQUAD CAR

text: streaking backward. She pulls the wheel to the right and brings her car across the front of the still stopping Pol Car. THE OFFICERS TRY TO BRING THEIR GUNS INTO PLAY AS THE Mer streaks in front of them.

head_text.subj: THE POLICE CAR EXPLODES. THE HOOD IS LIFTED OFF THE CAR.

text: Officers jump out of the vehicle, pouring shots after the retreating Mercury.
around her.

head_text.subj: THE MERCURY, BADLY RIDDLED, PULLS OUT ONTO THE HIGHWAY

text: ANOTHER SQUAD CAR COMES SPEEDING UP in the opposite direction. The Driver hits the brakes, the tires smoke al the street as the Black and White SCREAMS to a stop.

head_text.subj: CAROL PULLS THE MERCURY BY THE SQUAD CAR

text: THE POLICE CAR - THE FRONT AND BACK FENDERS ARE HIT; the wheels disintegrate - the impact of the shells rocks the Black and White upward.

head_text.subj: THE SECOND PASSENGER COP, FIRING A .38 OUT HIS BACK WINDO

text: the Mercury as it streaks down the road. Three holes open on the trunk of the auto. DOC CAN SEE BOTH OFFICERS JUMP OUT OF THE SECOND Black an White through the rear window. Carol makes a quick turn o the highway.

head_text.subj: THE MERCURY ROARS DOWN THE DARK STREET INTO THE CITY'S

text: COMMERCIAL SECTION, suddenly slow, makes another sharp tu this time through a red light.

head_text.subj: DOWN A SMALLER STREET FILLED WITH SHOPS

text: CORNER, whips up to the curb - Doc and Carol jump out of car. She carries the suitcase, he hangs onto his big gun. DOC AND CAROL, MOVING DOWN A DESERTED SIDEWALK; the SOUND sirens. They round a corner, then quickly move into an al THE ALLEY IS NARROW, DESERTED. DOC AND CAROL pull back in an alcove as a prowl car goes SCREAMING down the street a off into the night. They continue down the alley. THE OPPOSITE ENTRANCE TO THE ALLEY IS BLOCKED BY a large metal garbage container, and the DRIVER empties two cans garbage into it. Then he starts across the narrow street beyond in order to grab several others. DOC LOOKS BEHIND HIM, THEN GRABS CAROL'S ARM. They run fo the container. Doc tosses the suitcase into the container jumps in, reaches back, pulls Carol in beside him. SIRENS again sound close by. AFTER A MOMENT, A LARGE GARBAGE TRUCK PULLS UP, lifts the container with hooks and dumps the garbage and Doc and Ca into the truck.

INSIDE THE TRUCK. Doc and Carol start to panic, but they room enough. WITHIN THE TRUCK DOC WIGGLES HIS .45 out of his jacket an into his hand. He, Carol and the suitcase are crushed tig amongst the garbage. A moment after Doc frees his gun, a of garbage descends on their shelter, partially obscuring them.
DOC AND CAROL SWEATING... BREATHING HARD. Again the SOUND sirens... the truck lurches forward.
THE TRUCK MOVES ALONG THE EMPTY STREETS, passing several prowling squad cars.

THE GARBAGE MAN DRIVING THE TRUCK, MAKING STOPS, throwing more refuse. The truck continues along. DOC AND CAROL - THEIR FACES COVERED WITH PERSPIRATION and flies... buried within their enclosure under the moist garbage.
THE TRUCK GROWLS ALONG THE RUTTED PATHWAY surrounded by a of open trash. Areas within the dump reveal the slow, smouldering fires...

head_text.subj: THE TRUCK BACKS UP TO A HUGE CRATER HALF-FILLED WITH REFU
THE DRIVER REVS THE ENGINE, PULLS THE BED LIFT GEAR

text: THE TRUCK BED RISES AND TILTS FORWARD, as the load of tra tumbles down the face of the crater. DOC AND CAROL SLIDE DOWN THE MOUNTAIN OF FILTH, and stumb forward they climb into a large cardboard box. THE DRIVER GETS OUT OF THE CAB, checks to see that the garbage is gone from the truck bed. On his way back to th cab he finds a magazine to his liking near a shredded aut tire. With his newly-found prize, the Driver re-enters th truck and drives away. THE BOX LIES AT THE BOTTOM OF THE CRATER AMONGST the brok bottles, melon rinds, flashlight batteries, tin cans, use tires. DOC SAWS AT A CORNER OF THE CARDBOARD BOX with his penkni The matted paper gives away, allowing them more room with the box. DOC
Okay? CAROL
I think so... I don't know. Doc puts his hand to her face, wiping away a thin trace o blood from a scratch. DOC
It's not deep.
Carol tries to smile for the first time in quite a while.
No scars?
No scars. Doc looks across the garbage through the open end of the crate. THE HEAT AND THE FLIES HAVE BECOME UNBEARABLE. Carol begi to scratch her leg. DOC (CONT'D)
Don't scratch it, just rub, you'll get an infection. Carol ignores him, she is in bad shape. DOC (CONT'D)
(continuing) Do what I tell you, it's not a game. CAROL
It's all a game, don't bother me. Doc stares at the garbage around them. DOC
We better stick here till tonight.
(down) Yeah. Doc smiles, trying to get her to smile again. DOC
We're going to make it. CAROL
(further down) Sure... Carol rubs one hand along her now terribly soiled, tweed suit. She looks away from Doc. Doc stares at her mussed hair an tear-stained cheeks. DOC
I want to say something.
CAROL
(quiet defeat) I don't want to hear it. DOC
(softly) Listen to me. It's hard enough. Carol turns back, faces Doc. Their eyes find one another. DOC (CONT'D)
(continuing) Look, what you said yesterday... I guess that was right. It isn't worth anything if we don't make it together. CAROL
I don't think we can any more... If we ever get out of here, maybe I should take off... DOC
We got this far. CAROL
We've come a lot of miles. But we're not close to anything. DOC
I guess you're right. A pause. CAROL
I always thought jails make people hard. Not you. You're just not tough enough to forget about Beynon. I chose you, not him. DOC
Either we pick it up or else we leave it right here. We got to go one way or another. CAROL
(setting the condition) No more about Beynon. DOC
Whatever happens it's over. A pause.
CAROL
(not trusting his mouth) Sounds good. DOC
You want to try with me? CAROL
(smiling) Things can't get much worse can they? DOC
I don't see how. A long moment. CAROL
(finally talcing Doc's arm) Okay. DOC
(slow smile) You and me. CAROL
Can we make it? DOC
We get to Mexico, we can have a life. CAROL
That's all I want... It's the only thing I have ever wanted. As she pulls herself against him: DOC
I'm going to try and get it for you. They pull each other closer, tightly holding one another.

head_text.subj: RUDY IS LYING IN BED READING A NEWSPAPER PILLED WITH DOC

text: CAROL. The fact that they have been seen in the North. He smiles. Fran is in the bed beside him asleep naked under the shee RUDY
(calling softly) Harold, you've had ten minutes, get out of there. No answer. Rudy gets up and crosses to the bathroom.
HAROLD IS HANGING FROM A BRACKET. Very dead and not very pretty. Rudy looks at him, then sits on the John continui to read his paper.

head_text.subj: CAROL AND DOC CLIMB OUT OF THE GARBAGE AND BEGIN WALKING
DOC AND CAROL HUDDLED TOGETHER ON THE FLOOR OF THE EMPTY

text: They hold one another tightly fighting the cold and the relentless roar of metal wheels.
CAROL AND DOC ARE THE ONLY CUSTOMERS. They sit in booths while their clothes are being cleaned (doors open at bott

head_text.subj: DOC AND CAROL WASH THE GRIME FROM THEIR HANDS AND FACES.
DOC AND CAROL WALK THROUGH LIKE TOURISTS.
RUDY AND FRAN ENTER THE HOTEL, EACH OF THEM CARRYING

text: Cannon watches them from across the room, carefully clean his teeth with a cinnamon toothpick.
LAUGHLIN LEADS RUDY AND FRAN down the dark-walled hallway stopping before room number 4l8. Laughlin turns the key i the lock, opens the door. LAUGHLIN
It's hard to figure. There's something about the composition of the track at Pimlico... You can't go by the clock, any speed horse, take a second off any other track in the country.
LAUGHLIN

(continuing) ... but a speed horse is the only thing that consistently holds form. They got to let 'em run, dumb God damn trainers try to rate 'em, just breaks their heart. Rudy kicks the door shut with a slam, grabs Laughlin's shoulder, spins him around, hits him full in the stomach. Laughlin begins to fall Rudy catches him, wallops him aga in the mid-section, then throws him back into a ratty armchair. Rudy instantly pulls out his .44 and shoves it against Laughlin's mouth. RUDY
Okay, sweetpea, you get two choices. Live or die. RUDY (CONT'D)
Do what I tell you, you not only get to live, but maybe you'll pick up some money. LAUGHLIN
(still breathless) Just tell me. RUDY
First things first. Main thing, you work for me, otherwise I get you. If I don't, six months from now one of my friends will.

head_text.subj: CANNON AT PHONE BOOTH. HE SLIPS A DIME INTO THE SLOT.
THE ACCOUNTANT HANGS UP THE PHONE.

text: ACCOUNTANT
El Paso. Laughlin's. Rudy's arrived.

head_text.subj: DOC IN PHONE BOOTH PLACES CALL

text: LAUGHLIN
Sure, Doc. I can do it. Just like old times... Yeah, it's a nervous way to live.

head_text.subj: CAROL AND DOC SIT ON A WOODEN BENCH AT A PARK NEAR THE HO

text: THE BLACK SUITCASE is on the ground. ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE BENCH IS LAUGHLIN'S. FOUR stor of red brick.

head_text.subj: A DOC GETS UP AND CROSSES TO THE HOTEL WITHOUT THE BAG
DOC ENTERS AND CROSSES TO LAUGHLIN WHO IS BEHIND THE DESK

text: The switchboard is now vacant. DOC
Jimmy. How's it going? LAUGHLIN

(shaking hands, laughing) Good to see you, Doc. (handing him a paper) It's all there, departure, arrival - everything except the $500. Doc pays him, looks closely into his eyes. Jimmy hasn't changed and it's set. DOC
How's Mama and the kids? LAUGHLIN
Growing -- all of them - every day. (then) 318, you'll be the only ones on the floor. DOC
My lady'11 come in in about five minutes. Have some food sent up in half an hour. LAUGHLIN
Just sandwiches... DOC
Right.
He picks up the room key. Doc starts for the elevator. DOC (CONT'D)
When she gets here, have that kid of yours help her with the suitcase. LAUGHLIN
He took the day off. DOC
Then you do it. LAUGHLIN

Can't leave the desk. Doc gives Laughlin a half-pissed look, then crosses to th elevator and pulls the cage door open. LAUGHLIN WATCHES THE RICKETY, self-service elevator move upward. He reaches for the desk phone.

FRAN, WEARING ONLY A BATHROBE, is doing her nails while watching an old movie on the black and white tube, seated the bed. The phone begins to RING. Fran looks over to Rudy from her overstuffed armchair. RUDY
Okay, Grunt, pick it up.

head_text.subj: CAROL EMERGES THROUGH THE SLIDING DOOR AND TURNS DOWN THE

text: CORRIDOR. She walks slowly, carrying the heavy suitcase. Reaching the door to room 31oj Carol knocks rapidly three times, waits, then raps out two sets of two knocks. The d swings open and Doc stands within the archway. She enters Doc shuts the door and slips his arms around Carol, revea his .45 automatic in one hand.

RUDY IS SPINNING THE CHAMBER on his .44 then shoves it in his coat pocket. Fran is getting dressed in the middle of room, her breasts and thighs ripple outward from the conf of the bra and girdle. THE CALICO KITTEN SLEEPS PEACEFULLY IN ITS cardboard box.

CAROL IS IN THE SHOWER, STEAM HANGS IN THE AIR as she vigorously soaps her body, cleansing herself of the resid left from their cross-country flight. DOC IN THE MAIN ROOM IS STANDING AT THE LARGE windows fac across to the building next to Laughlins. The fire escape one story beneath him. Doc crosses, throws the suitcase o the bed, undoes the straps and snaps, lifts the lid open. stares at the huge amount of money for a moment, then dig into the suitcase, reaching down to the bottom. He withdr his hand, holding four visas.. He puts two of them on the bureau drawer top... the other two he begins to tear into sections and places them into a large ashtray. He touches match to the scraps. THE FLAMES CURL AROUND RUDY'S PHOTOGRAPH in the ashtray.

head_text.subj: THE ACCOUNTANT., SWAIN, CULLY AND HAYHOE APPROACH A PARKE
ON THE BED IN DOC AND CAROL'S ROOM, THE SUITCASE IS NOW

text: CLOSED; the .45 automatic sits beside it... Doc's overcoa also lies across the bedpsread, near it the wrapped shotg The poster is again on the wall. CAROL still in the bathroom of room 318. She wears only a slip. Carol is washing out her bra and panties in the washbasin, using a coarse bar of soap. Doc enters; he beg taking off his shirt. DOC
We've got some food coming, should be here any minute. CAROL
Great. I'm going to sleep twelve hours. DOC
Ten. Laughlin's going to take us across at four A.M. CAROL
(mild complaint) Oh, Jesus... how?
DOC
Jeep. There's a dry river bed fifteen miles east. He takes us to the Mexican side, drops us off at the airfield by breakfast... we've got a 9 o'clock flight. CAROL
(smiles) I'll be ready.
(down) Yeah. CAROL
What's wrong? DOC
(shrugs) I don't know. CAROL
Get in the shower. You'll feel okay. DOC
(smile) Whatever you say.
AS RUDY AND FRAN EMERGE FROM THEIR ROOM. The door shuts behind them, Rudy guides Fran to the stairs.

head_text.subj: DOC STANDS IN THE SHOWER, THE HARD SPRAY BREAKING OVER TH

text: BACK OF HIS SKULL. Tired, he closes his eyes, rests the s of his head against the tile.

CAROL STILL WEARING THE SLIP, she lies back across the be Her eyelids slowly fall shut. Carol has pushed the suitca overcoat and .45 off to one side. RUDY AND FRAN COME DOWN THE STAIRS. Rudy puts one hand in his overcoat.

head_text.subj: AS THE HOOD DRIVES, SWAIN IS BESIDE HIM IN THE FRONT, CUL

text: THE ACCOUNTANT AND HAYHOE ride in the back seat.
CAROL IS NAPPING LIGHTLY ON THE BED AS DOC BURSTS out of bathroom... again dressed in his shorts, holding his pant one hand. DOC
Get upI Carol's eyes snap open. DOC (CONT'D)
(continuing) We're moving now! He quickly pulls his pants on... CAROL
What is it? DOC
Laughlin. He's always got his family around... that wife and kid of his have to stand by his side to make sure he stays off the juice and horses.
So what?
If they are not here, he must have sent them away.
RUDY AND FRAN STEP INTO THE HALLWAY TOWARD ROOM 3l8a pass several rooms. Fran's face is taut. Rudy starts his nervo grin.
CAROL
You're crazy.
(hard) Get your clothes on, move your butt. She looks at him, doesn't move.
Sorry. Look, I'm clean. I want to get some rest.
She is interrupted by a hard knock on the door. Doc drops shirt to the floor. He quickly reaches down, lifts his .4 Doc gestures to Carol... she moves towards the door. CAROL (CONT'D)
(continuing; now at doorway) Who is it?
Fran stands at the door to 318. Rudy is at her shoulder; has taken out his revolver. FRAN
It's your food, I brought up your sandwiches... INSIDE 318
Carol standing near the door., looks at Doc. He mouths and half-whispers: DOC
Stall. Doc whips his pen knife out of his pocket, crosses the ro to the locked door of an adjoining hotel room. He begins forcing the lock. CAROL
Just leave it outside the door... I'm not dressed right now. After a moment: FRAN

I can't do that, ma'am. You have to pay now so I can pay back the boy that went out and got the food... DOC working on the door; his .45 shoved into the waistban his pants. CAROL thinking hard... CAROL

All right. You'll have to hold on a minute, my husband's in the shower... DOC breaks the lock and opens the door -- he quickly cros the dark apartment, moves to the front door, slips out hi automatic, then gingerly cracks the door. His eyes tighte amazement as he sees:

RUDY STANDING SLIGHTLY BEHIND FRAN, his .44 held tightly to the door jamb, ready for instantaneous use. Rudy and F are 15 feet down the hallway from Doc's slightly opened d They both have their backs turned to him in three-quarter fashion. DOC BAREFOOTED., BARE-CHESTED; he decides on a course of action. The door swings quietly open. WITHIN THE HALLWAY, DOC CLOSES THE DISTANCE between himse and Rudy in two swift strides, Rudy turns,, swinging his too late, as Doc's .45 crashes against his head. Rudy dro Fran screams. Rudy looks at Doc, still smiling, eyes glaz He falls abruptly. Doc stands over the fallen body. Fran continues to scream. Doc finally turns away from Rudy, looking now at the screaming woman. He flattens her with left hook to the jaw. Fran drops to the floor as if she h been shot. Suddenly everything in the corridor is silent. RUDY'S HEAD IS BLOODIED. He lies without movement.

head_text.subj: DOC NOW SLAMS AT THE DOOR OF 318

text: DOC
Open it up, it's me. Carol swings the door open. Doc bursts back into the room grabs his shirt, begins to button it. DOC (CONT'D)
(continuing) Come on, come on. CAROL
Who was it? DOC
Just get your clothes on...

AS DOC AND CAROL COME BACK OUT OF 318 they step over the fallen bodies and start toward the waiting elevator. Carol stops as she recognizes Rudy. Doc pulls her along, forcing her to keep moving. Carol again carries the brown suitcase, Doc holds the shotgun. They go down the back (o front) stairs.

head_text.subj: THE ACCOUNTANT STANDS AT ONE CORNER OP THE RECEPTION COUN

text: IN THE LOBBY OF LAUGHLINS. Within an alcove behind and to side of the desk (the area serving as an office) Cully, S and Hayhoe have stretched Laughlin across the pine desk. Accountant eyes both the empty lobby and the entrance to hotel3 acting as lookout. CULLY INSIDE THE ALCOVE LIFTS A SNAPPED OFF LEG of the he chair to use as a club. The thug turns back to the desk w Swain and Hayhoe have Laughlin pinioned.
Just tell us the room number. LAUGHLIN LOOKS BACK AT CULLY. He is very frightened but s nothing.

head_text.subj: CULLY SLAMS THE WOODEN CLUB DOWN ON LAUGHLIN KNEECAP

text: Now you want to tell me?
McCoy's in 318., the other guy's in 420.
Sure about that? He again whacks Laughlin's knee.
DOC AND CAROL EMERGE,, MOVING QUICKLY FOR THE. main entra They get five steps before simultaneously seeing the Accountant.
Doc ! Doc and Carol freeze for an instant. The Accountant snaps his fingers twice. Cully lowers his club, looks to the Accountant, as do Swa and Hayhoe. The Accountant smiles, staring at Doc and Car
(calmly to his men) Out here.
CULLY, SWAIN AND HAYHOE APPEAR FROM THE ALCOVE BEHIND the Accountant. They look over his shoulder toward the rear o the hotel, their eyes finding Doc and Carol.

head_text.subj: DOC HAS ONE HAND IN HIS OUTSIDE COAT POCKET, WRAPPED

text: around the .45. Carol continues to hold the suitcase up i front of herself, almost like a shield. The distance betw Doc and Carol and the hotel entrance has been effectively off by the four opponents standing near the reception des Carol edges backward a few steps, toward the massive wood staircase. ACCOUNTANT
Just have her set it down. Doc's hand comes out of his coat pocket, a slow gesture revealing that his palm is empty. DOC
You want it? Come and take it.

head_text.subj: THE ACCOUNTANT NOW PLANKED BY THE THREE MEN

text: ACCOUNTANT

(quietly) Get him. As the three men reach for their guns. DOC MOVES MUCH PASTER. HE DUCKS TO   THE RIGHT, levels th disguised shotgun and fires in the   same movement. The reception desk near the Accountant   splinters from the b and he is hit painfully. The other   three men duck away the sudden burst of fire power.

head_text.subj: DOC AND CAROL JUMP FOR THE STAIRS

text: HAYHOE LEVELS HIS PISTOL AT THE RETREATING COUPLE Another shot from Doc's riot gun... this one breaking open the fl at Hayhoe's feet and cutting him down at the knees. Canno Cully, Swain and Max open fire as they dive for cover. Th miss their shots, digging up walls, stairs and flooring. ON THE WINDING STAIRWAY DOC AND CAROL FLEE UPWARD She struggles with the heavy suitcase, Doc transfers the riot to his left hand, pulls out the more accurate .45 to use his right.

head_text.subj: WITHIN THE LOBBY THE SIX MEN SPLIT FORCES

text: Cully and the Accountant run to the elevator, enter it, p the door shut. Swain and Hayhoe, limping, and Cannon and start for the stairwell in direct pursuit of Doc and Caro All the men, save the Accountant, now have guns in their hands. SWAIN AND HAYHOE CAUTIOUSLY GOING UPWARD. Still below the first level landing, their eyes search overhead. The SOUN Doc and Carol's pounding feet can be heard. HAYHOE LEANS OUT OVER THE BANISTER, points his gun direct up and fires. DOC AND CAROL BETWEEN THE FIRST AND SECOND FLOOR landings Hayhoe's bullet tears by, ripping through the wooden bani supports. INSIDE THE ELEVATOR THE ACCOUNTANT AND CULLY WATCH the ar indicator pass "Two." DOC AIMING HIS .45 RESTING IT ON THE BANISTER He fires tw shots back down the stairwell. SWAIN AND HAYHOE MOVING UP THE STEPS TWO AT A TIME Sudden Hayhoe's leg buckles as a .45 slug tears through his hip, other bullet ripping the plaster wall near his shoulder. SWAIN IS NOW BESIDE THE BANISTER, he points his 54l revol straight up... empties it. DOC AND CAROL AS SWAIN'S BULLETS BREAK AROUND THEM. Doc p Carol down, lifts the riot gun and fires down the stairwe with a huge roar. THE STAIRCASE TEN FEET IN FRONT OF SWAIN IS SMASHED by Do blast. Swain has to climb over the uprooted planking to continue moving upward. Cannon following.
CULLY PULLS OPEN THE DOOR, MOVES OUT INTO THE corridor. T Accountant remains within the elevator.

head_text.subj: SWAIN ON THE STAIRWAY FIRES HIS PISTOL UPWARD

text: CAROL, ON THE STAIRWAY ABOVE, AS THE SHOTS SMASH PAST, ru ahead of Doc by three steps. They pass the second landing keep moving upwards towards the third.
Doc's focus of attention is downward. He knows that he an Carol are being pursued up the stairwell, but he isn't aw of the fact that the gunsels have split their forces.

head_text.subj: RUDY ON THE THIRD FLOOR AGAIN RISES LIKE LAZARUS FROM THE

text: DEAD. His head bloodied from Doc's heavy pistol, he slowl wobbles to his feet. Rudy looks down at Fran... she sobs violently, her back leaning against the wall. Rudy picks his .44 then stumbles into the open door of Doc and Carol room. He unsteadily crosses to the bathroom, closes the d CAROL FRANTICALLY MOVING UPWARD, DOC HAS NOW FALLEN five steps behind.

head_text.subj: DOC FIRES THE .45 DOWN THE STAIRWELL AT

text: Cully walks cautiously down the corridor, pistol raised. moves toward the landing, having covered one quarter of t distance from the elevator. The Accountant is still withi the elevator. Carol comes up the stairwell and looks back for Doc. The SOUND of Swain's pistol and Doc's answering .45. Carol se a movement; she turns and sees Cully's gun leveled at her Carol screams: Doc dives onto the landing facing the corridor... his pla of movement knee high.,, the riot gun in his left hand, . in his right. CULLY IS HIT IN THE CHEST BY BUCKSHOT. The killing wounds fling him upward as he fires his own gun... his aim destr by the death blows,, the bullets stray above Carol, high their mark.

head_text.subj: DOC FIRES THREE TIMES MORE AT THE ELEVATOR CABLE
THE CORRIDOR WALL NEAR THE ELEVATOR IS SMASHED BY ONE OF

text: riot gun's jumbo shots, as is the top of the elevator. Th plaster flies away revealing further damage. The cables a smashed, the elevator breaks loose and plummets downward.

head_text.subj: THE EMERGENCY CABLE, INSIDE THE SHAFT

text: THE MECHANISM TRANSFERS OVER, line catching within the pu housing. The line snaps taut - halting the speeding car.

head_text.subj: AS THE ELEVATOR SLAMS TO A WRENCHING STOP FIVE FEET

text: ABOVE the floor level. The Accountant bounces from the fl of the car to the ceiling, then back to the floor. Laughlin leans across the reception desk in great pain. H sees the suspended car through the iron grill door. The Accountant lies completely still on the floor of the elevator. His head and neck twisted at an oblique angle.

head_text.subj: DOC ON THE THIRD FLOOR LANDING

text: HE JAMS SEVERAL SHELLS INTO HIS RIOT GUN WHILE HOLDING hi .45 ready for an appearance by Swain. Reloading completed stands, with Carol. He again begins to move upward.
DOC STOPS, SETS BOTH THE RIOT GUN AND THE .45 on 562 the banister... He waits... on the winding staircase below hi there is a dark movement.
THE STAIRWELL AROUND SWAIN DISINTEGRATES. The thug is obliterated by the firepower. DOC CANNOT SEE THE EFFECT OF HIS SHOTS. He again resumes flight upward.

RUDY HOLDS HIS BLOODY HEAD IN THE SINK BOWL, DUMBLY splas water over himself. Carol's underwear is still present. Rudy's pistol lies on the soap tray. THE LANDING AS DOC AND CAROL COME POUNDING INTO VIEW. No further avenues open, they turn down the corridor. Doc gr Carol and pushes her into the room, past Fran; he kicks t door shut.
DOC GRABS THE SUITCASE, RUNS TO THE WINDOW, TEARS off the shade, lifts the frame, looks. The drop is too far. He gr Carol and runs into the hallway.
THEY RUN DOWN TWO DOORS AND BREAK IN. Over the door is th sign "Fire Escape."
DOC HELPS CAROL OUT ONTO THE FIRE ESCAPE. He aids her wit his left hand, the riot gun now clutched tightly in his right. He motions, she hands him the suitcase and follows

THEY DESCEND THE FIRE ESCAPE. They reach the end. The fir escape stays rigid. Doc cautiously steps on to the tilted steps. He turns and with the suitcase crosses to the end. Throws the bag and shotgun across the 6 foot gap to the retaining wall, preparing to jump. RUDY COMES OUT OF THE ROOM ONTO THE FIRE ESCAPE holding h .44. He looks down at Doc, then slowly raises his gun. Ca screams. DOC JUMPS. RUDY FIRES. DOC IS HIT IN THE SIDE (flesh woun In the air he spins and lands. Rudy fires again and again he runs down the fire escape. Doc rolls, picks up the sho and fires. RUDY'S TIME HAS COME. THE JUMBO CHARGES MASH HIM BACK aga the wall and off the fire escape. CAROL RUNS ALMOST STAGGERING AND GETS READY TO JUMP the s feet. THE FIRE ESCAPE. BEGINS TO SINK. CAROL LOOKS AT DOC mutel as she sinks beneath the retaining wall. DOC

(his hand out) Jump! And she does. He catches her and pulls her up. They look at one another for a long moment, then he stand and helps her to her feet, and leaving the shotgun behind they walk into the alley.
IN A PARKING LOT AT THE END OF THE ALLEY, SLIM, a tough, grizzly Western is about to pull out. Doc opens the back and Carol gets in. Doc opens the front door as Slim turns looks at him.
DOC
(.45 in hand, pointing) Drive. SLIM
Suit yourself. He lets out a yell and guns across the lot over the four drop to the sidewalk and into and off a car and into the street. SLIM (CONT'D)
(grinning) How was that? DOC
(smiling in spite of himself) Just fine. SLIM
Where we go in1? DOC
Mexico. I'd like to find a quiet place to cross. SLIM
Why not? The car pulls forward as the light blinks to green.

AS THE CAR PASSES AN INTERSECTION, SEVERAL POLICE cars ca seen arriving at the front of Laughlins. The car continues moving up the street, then makes a righ onto a larger boulevard. Doc half turns to Carol. DOC
You okay? CAROL
(nodding) Where do we go from here? DOC
I don't know, airport I guess.
CAROL
They will have our description before we can get a plane. DOC
(way down) Yeah. SLIM
I guess you ain't gonna shoot me, are you? DOC
I kinda doubt it. Slim is obviously pleased that some excitement has come i his life. SLIM
That's good... I'll cooperate, don't worry about that... yes sir, I've had some trouble with the law myself. Doc and Carol look at the man. SLIM (CONT'D)
Three years ago I dynamited some fish at the reservoir. CAROL
(beginning to laugh) Oh my God. SLIM
That little job cost me a hundred dollars... didn't even get to keep the fish. DOC
(resigned to the insanity of the moment) Let's just get to the border. SLIM
Sure thing, mister, it's coming right up. 'Bout an hour. Quiet crossing that is.

head_text.subj: THE AMERICAN OFFICIALS SIMPLY WAVE THE CAR BY.

text: At the white line a Mexican CUSTOMS OFFICER emerges from station house. As he looks inside the car:
OFFICIAL
Buenas tardes... Your destination. SLIM
(speaking right up) Chihuahua... gonna do some sightseeing. The Official smiles and motions them past.

head_text.subj: AS IT HEADS INTO CHIHUAHUA ON THE MEXICAN SIDE.

text: Which way? DOC
Juarez - Chihuahua City road. SLIM
Don't you want to go to the airport?
Not now. CAROL
How long before this car's hot? DOC
(after a moment) Pull over. Slim stops the car near the soft shoulder of the dirt roa Doc looks at Slim. DOC (CONT'D)
(continuing) Listen... how much money did you make this year? SLIM
(slightly offended) What's it to you? DOC
(patient) Come on. How much? SLIM
'Bout five thousand.
DOC
How about if I buy your car for ten grand? SLIM
You serious? DOC
Sure am. SLIM
And I keep my mouth shut? DOC
That's what I want. SLIM
I don't report the car and I don't know either of you? DOC
You got it. SLIM
How about twenty thousand? -DOC
How about thirty? SLIM
(delighted) Done, by God. Doc turns to Carol. DOC
Pay the man. As she begins to open the suitcase...

head_text.subj: A WAD OF MONEY DISAPPEARING INTO SLIM'S POCKET

text: DOC
You're going to have to walk back to the border. SLIM
Don't worry about me, I'll grab a cab... I can afford it, you know.
Slim steps out of the car, Carol moves into the front sea Doc slides behind the wheel. SLIM (CONT'D)
(continuing, leaning through the window) Hope you get to where you're going. CAROL
Thanks. Hope you do too. SLIM
By the way, you're getting a hell of a car there, mister. DOC
(laughs) Well, I paid a hell of a price. Now for God's sake keep your mouth shut. SLIM
(his pride hurt) Wish you hadn't said that. When Slim Canfield's lips are sealed, they're sealed. DOC
(smiles) Go with God. DOC SLIPS THE CAR into gear. SLIM
One thing though... how do I explain this to my wife? CAROL
Tell her you robbed a bank... The car pulls forward. Slim waves goodbye, then turns and begins walking back down the highway.

head_text.subj: BACK INSIDE THE CAR, DOC ACCELERATES AWAY

text: CAROL
Are we going to make it? DOC
Hell, I don't know... but we sure gave it a run.
CAROL
(positive with a small smile) Whatever happens... we're going all the way. DOC
(smiles) Yeah, why not? We're the good guys. CAROL
I guess we are. After a moment: DOC
Why don't you try the news? Carol snaps on the radioj the voice of a Mexican announce heard. CAROL
No more news, from now on we're just going to listen to music. She spins the dial. Mariachi music comes on.

head_text.subj: AS THEY HIT THE MAIN HIGHWAY, DOC PULLS OFF AND STOPS.

text: What now?

We walk. THEY ARE WALKING ALONG THE HIGHWAY, THE EDSEL IS now a do the background. Another dot appears, grows bigger, as it closer it is a bus. Very Mexican but very Greyhound in appearance. Doc and Carol turn, Doc flags it down. It pulls to a stop, they board. The bus pulls out.

head_text.subj: DOC PAYS AND THEN FOLLOWS CAROL TO A SEAT.

text: They sit. Mexico rolls by outside the window. They look at each other and smile.
VOICE (O.S.)
Hey! Doc and Carol look back. THE BLACK PANTHER IS LEANING OVER THE SEAT, his empty fis cocked up like a pistol. He grins. BLACK PANTHER
(pulling the trigger) Bang! Doc and Carol look at him. FREEZE FRAME.
